column4: hi, i updated ubuntu and now it wont boot. i got a suggestion to reinstall grub from livecd. i am now trying this.. but when i do sudo grub-install ..(args here),  i get a warning: warn: "Attempting to install GRUB to a partition instead of the MBR.  This is a BAD idea.."
/usr/sbin/grub-setup: warn: Embedding is not possible.  GRUB can only be installed in this setup by using blocklists.  However, blocklists are UNRELIABLE and its use is discouraged..
why doesnst grub-install install itself in the MBR?
not sure, should ask the devs that question =)
ooh i picked /dev/sda  in stead of /dev/sda1 now.. and that works!
i dont know what sda or sda1 mean
i could use some extra knowlegde:)
oh, sda1 means partition 1 on sda
